Articles.Content:
It may not be the place to post this, but it seems to me that it has the scope for everyone to read it and take knowledge.

I've seen that many are happening to them, that the KAL-1000 loses track in the worst moments.

Elaborate designs, when selected in the midst of mission, have the unpleasant surprise that the hard work done in the VAR has DISAPPEARED.

In my case, I have noticed what happens when I have several ships of equal design on mission, and I perform the "Switch to" occurs the inconvenience. I think that even when I use the keyboard shortcut ("through ships"), it causes the failure.

For two days, more by intuition than by code knowledge foundation, I no longer use the "Switch to", and I carry out the cumbersome task of going to "Tracking Station" and from there selecting another ship.

It seems that this avoids conflict and so far, with the procedure described, the Kal-1000 tracks have not been erased. 


Luck!
